articles.description: As Special Counsel Robert Mueller's investigation into Russian interference in the 2016 presidential election continues, Wired reports the team interviewed "at least one member of Facebook's team that was associated with President Trump's 2016 presidential ca…
articles.title: Mueller investigation interviews Facebook staff in Russia probe
articles.author: Richard Lawler

articles.description: As special counsel Robert Mueller's investigation grows, at least one Facebook employee who worked alongside the 2016 Trump campaign has been pulled into the probe.
articles.title: Robert Mueller's Russia Investigation Includes at Least One Facebook Employee Interview
articles.author: Issie Lapowsky

articles.description: Plus: Elon Musk's $0 salary, details form Uber's secretive Strategic Services Group, and more slightly catastrophic news from this week.
articles.title: Tesla's Autopilot Crashes and More Car News This Week
articles.author: Aarian Marshall

articles.description: Today, lawyers for Julian Assange asked a court in the UK to drop the warrant that’s currently standing for the WikiLeaks founder’s arrest. Their argument? In short, it’s perhaps best summed up by the Fonz just saying “ eyyyyyyyy ” and walking off. Read more.…
articles.title: Julian Assange Asks UK Court to Drop Arrest Warrant by Invoking the Fonzie Defense
articles.author: Matt Novak

articles.description: US Immigration and Customs Enforcement has finalized a contract granting them agency-wide access to a national license plate recognition database, The Verge reported Friday. License plate readers are increasingly common in law enforcement agencies across the …
articles.title: ICE to Gain Access to Nationwide License Plate Database
articles.author: Sidney Fussell

articles.description: The Environmental Protection Agency wants to reclassify major pollution sources like power plants and factories so that they face less regulation—and this spells trouble for the low-income communities and people of color who live near this pollution. Read mor…
articles.title: The EPA Wants to Regulate Factories Like Your Local Dry Cleaners
articles.author: Yessenia Funes on Earther, shared by Tom McKay to Gizmodo

articles.description: In a restrained speech, the president argued that his “America First” policies were consistent with the current global economic system.
articles.title: A Sober Trump Reassures the Davos Elite
articles.author: PETER BAKER

articles.description: The special counsel Robert Mueller at the Capitol in June. That month, reports say, President Trump ordered Mr. Mueller’s firing, but then backed down.
articles.title: Op-Ed Contributors: Trump Hasn’t Fired Mueller — Yet
articles.author: RICHARD W. PAINTER and NORMAN L. EISEN

articles.description: John F. Kelly, President Trump’s chief of staff, with Nick Ayers, the chief of staff for the vice president. It is hard to discern how Mr. Kelly views his job, or his relationship with the president, beyond a sense of duty.
articles.title: White House Memo: Trump’s Impromptu News Conference: An Unplanned Drop-By or a Deliberate Dig?
articles.author: MAGGIE HABERMAN

articles.description: If the president tried to fire Mueller in June, why are we only finding out now?
articles.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Trump’s Efforts to Oust Mueller Show the ‘Cancer’ on This Presidency
articles.author: HARRY LITMAN

articles.description: A Bombardier CSeries plane in 2015. The Commerce Department had recommended that the United States impose duties of nearly 300 percent on Bombardier’s new CSeries, but the International Trade Commission decided to revoke them.
articles.title: U.S. Panel Halts Trump Administration’s Bid for Tariffs on Canadian Jets
articles.author: ANA SWANSON

articles.description: Many analysts expect the estimate of economic growth to hit 3 percent for the third-straight quarter, a post-recession milestone.
articles.title: G.D.P. Report on Friday: An Economic Scorecard
articles.author: PATRICIA COHEN

articles.description: State of the State speeches happen every year, and many of them sound similar, highly staged and short of news. Tucked deep in them, though, were a few tidbits.
articles.title: The Nation’s Governors Spoke and We Found a Few Surprises. (Yes, Really.)

articles.description: Philadelphia Eagles safety Malcolm Jenkins has been at the center of N.F.L. players’ protests this season, fighting for criminal justice reform and addressing racial inequality.
articles.title: In a Busy Year, Malcolm Jenkins Raised a Fist and Checked All the Boxes

articles.description: In the story of American business, says Netflix's Dirty Money, Donald Trump is not a hero. He shouldn't be listed alongside Rockefeller, Ford, and Jobs, argues writer Tim O'Brien ; for Trump is P.T. Barnum. He's a self-promoter and a showman who will tell any…
articles.title: Netflix's 'Dirty Money' investigates Trump's dubious business history — and yup, the conclusions check out
articles.author: Proma Khosla

articles.description: In the words of Justin Bieber, is it too late now to say sorry? Well, for Donald Trump, it's apparently never too late to deliver a rather tepid apology for retweeting anti-Muslim unverified videos posted by the deputy leader of far-right group Britain First.…
articles.title: Trump tepidly offers 'I'm sorry if' apology for his anti-Muslim retweets
articles.author: Rachel Thompson

articles.description: It was one of the first and most striking examples of resistance against the Trump administration. On Jan. 27, 2017, President Donald Trump signed an executive order blocking refugees and citizens of seven predominantly Muslim countries from entering the U.S.…
articles.title: One year after Trump's first Muslim ban, #SendASign campaign continues fight for refugees
articles.author: Matt Petronzio

articles.description: There are a lot of metaphors available for the Trump Administration so far — like, say, a tire fire. Well, dollar lover and Treasury Secretary Steve Mnuchin gave us a new one Friday, when he literally pelted a journalist with a snowball on Friday morning. SEE…
articles.title: Steve Mnuchin pelting a reporter with a snowball is a pretty apt metaphor
articles.author: Marcus Gilmer

articles.title: 'The Last Jedi' director Rian Johnson reacts to Stormy Daniels' review of the movie because that's where we are now
